title: DSAN Student Potential Job Analysis
text:
Distribution of Job Search result over search location and job type, using histogram at left to filter search location
The analysis is based on a job search outcome focusing on DSAN study opportunities in Washington D.C. and across the United States. Both the DC region and the entire country exhibit remarkably similar distributions in terms of job types, despite minor variations in the time series aspect, particularly in relation to quantitative positions.

title: DSAN Student Potential Job Analysis
text:
WFH and Schedule Type








Distribution of Work From Home Job and Job Schedule Type, using the left histogram to select ability to WFH
As the search result in 2023, there is a majority of jobs requiring candidates to be present onsite. Furthermore, the job search results predominantly consist of full-time positions, accompanied by a few contractor and internship opportunities. Notably, there are no WFH internships identified in this particular job search, indicating a likelihood that interns will need to be physically present at the worksite.

title: DSAN Student Potential Job Analysis
text:
Job Locations







Top 10 states or regions for job locations, ‘Anywhere’ means WFH abilities,and USA means multiple location offered across the country








Top 10 job locations among search in DC or USA, using select box to select search location
Within the United States, it is evident that New York and California offer the highest number of job opportunities. Additionally, the DMV region is also identified as a favorable location in terms of job prospects. With location near Georgetown and potential connection we could find in DSAN, jobs in DMW regions could be good targets for students.

title: DSAN Student Potential Job Analysis
text:
Year of Experience








Histogram of minimum requirement of year of experience, job not listing YoE requirement is represented as 0
Based on the graph, it can be observed that a large proportion of job listings either do not have any minimum requirement for years of experience or have a relatively low requirement. This suggests that many of these jobs may be suitable for recent college graduates or individuals with limited work experience.

title: Skills Analysis
text: By selecting the common 10 skills offered in DSAN classes and searching for them in job qualifications, we can observe the relevance and requirement of these skills across different job positions. The results provide valuable insights into how these skills are sought after in various job roles within the job market. This information can be helpful in understanding the demand for these skills and tailoring one’s skillset accordingly to align with the job requirements.

title: Skills Analysis
text:
Skills Correlation







Based on the heatmap, it appears that Python is highly correlated with other skills in the job qualifications. This suggests that Python is a key skill that is commonly used in conjunction with other skills in various data science-related fields. The proficiency in Python is essential for performing tasks and analyses in data science.

title: Skills Analysis
text:
Further Look: ARM





I then conducted association rule mining to explore the skills required in jobs, the resulting plot revealed interesting insights: Notably, Python emerged as a highly interconnected skill, indicating its significant importance across various job domains. Moreover, SQL appeared to have connections with multiple fields and tools, suggesting that students interested in big data or data visualization could benefit from adding SQL to their skill set. Additionally, NLP, Deep Learning, and Optimization exhibited strong associations, indicating that students pursuing machine learning jobs could consider taking these three electives together.

title: Skills Analysis
text:
Further Look: Skills Tracing



                                                


The final graph visualizes the relationship between different skills and job types, showing how 10 specific skills are required for each job type. The lines on the graph trace the skill requirements for each job type, with Data Science and Deep Learning jobs requiring a broad range of skills, student need to learn almost all skills to fit the qualifications. In contrast, for Time Series or Blockchain jobs, students could focus on fewer skills and explore them in more depth.

title: Job Site Analysis
text: Based on the analysis, LinkedIn, ZipRecruiter, and Upwork emerge as the top three job sites with the highest number of opportunities. Additionally, other significant job sites include AngelList, Lever, and Greenhouse. I select top 5 job sites, with each of them having more than 20 results, for further studies.

title: Job Site Analysis
text:
Job Type








The analysis indicates that LinkedIn and ZipRecruiter offer a balanced distribution of various types of jobs, while Upwork has a higher proportion of jobs related to neural networks and machine learning. On the other hand, Lever has a greater emphasis on data analytics positions. Additionally, LinkedIn and Upwork are the only two sites that feature some time-series jobs. As a result, ANLY 560 students may want to focus more on these two websites for job opportunities related to time-series analysis.








Graph of Minimum YoE requirementin different job sites, using legend bar to select job site
According to the analysis, LinkedIn and Lever offer more job opportunities that are suitable for experienced students, as they require a minimum number of years of experience. In contrast, Upwork has a higher proportion of job listings that do not require any prior experience, making it more suitable for new graduates.
